intro: Cyrtandra natewaensis, commonly known as the Natewa ginger. It is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands, specifically found on the island of Maui. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Cyrtandra natewaensis is a shrub that can grow up to several feet tall, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal habitats.
